basic_info.description: My name is Beau Hibbert, I attended Washington State University to study economics and eventually got a job in the banking industry. After working for a couple of years, I came to the conclusion that the banking industry was not the right fit for me and decided that being a software engineer would be a smart move as it's one of the fastest growing industries. I really enjoy doing research and applying that newfound knowledge to increase performance in myself and others. With my background in economics and now software engineering, I am looking towards finding a role where I can continue to develop my skills and solve complex problems.

projects.title: Dungeon
projects.description: Final Project for class 201. Used CSS, HTML, and JavaScript to build out the website. The website was a side scrolling question and answer learning tool designed for new developers entering the .

projects.title: Salmon Cookies
projects.description: The idea of this project was to build out a website for a cookie company with several different locations around the world. Not only did I design the website, but also aggragated sales data and displayed it in a way that made it easy to compare stores and see how they were doing.

projects.title: Final Project
projects.description: One of the first apps I was working on my internship. I had to develop front-end implementation for app that shows 3D models of known buildings. This was also my first project in Angular framework. I've learned a lot!
